item.title: Prediction-Realization Diagram
item.description: Read dataset example1_AFTS.csv from URL: data <- read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/forvis/forvision_data/master/example1_AFTS.csv") Prediction-realization diagram We can use the following code to see the prediction-realization diagram: library(forvision) plotPRD(data) The prediction-realization diagram for the selected methods: # For the methods "A" and "B" data1 <- subset(data, method == c("A", "B")) library(forvision) plotPRD(data1) The prediction-realization diagram for the selected horizon: # For the horizons 1, 2 data2 <- subset(data, horizon == 1:2) library(forvision) plotPRD(data2)

item.title: Fanchart
item.description: Using this function we can see how forecasts made for a specified origin correspond to actuals: plottf(ts, fc, series_id="M1", origin="Jun 1989")
